text: Pours a paling yellow with a white lacing. Aroma is vinegar, grape must and what I can imagine cloudberries taste like.

2015 vintage. Bottle shared at Akkurat. Hazy orange color with white head. Aroma is minty, some cloudberries (at least as far as I remember from the jam), nice funk. Taste is dry, cloudberries, extremely dry, but with lots of flavour. Medium carbonation. A real masterpiece, so much perfectly incorporated fruit, and so dry.

Bottle shared at Cantillon by Jean. Big thanks, boss. Pours hazy bright orange with a small white head. Aroma is PACKED with cloudberries, wet grass, citrussy zesty notes, some lemon, cheesy and cellar funk. A subtle acetone that thankfully disappeared after a little warming up. The smell on this is BONKERS. Taste is just as good. Huge cloudberry up front, lots of zesty flavours, huge cellar funk here aswell. So happy to finally have tried this!
Poured at the brewery. Pours Golden clear yellow, aromas of seabuckthorn and a crisp acidity - super transparent, the cloudberries clearly dominates this beer. Long sour finish

Bottle (75 cl) shared at Akkurat, Stockholm, Sweden. Clear deep golden to orange. Odd, phenolic aroma, could not pick up any cloudberries. Dry, medium to high acidity. The least good Cantillon Ive had.

Bottle at Akkurat. Pours clear orange with a highly effervescent white head. Aroma is basement, sweaty socks, parmsean cheese, berries. Taste is light citrus, mouldy brie cheese, berry tart, modestly zesty lemon rind. A lightly citric, cheesy and tart berry affair. Modest carbonation.

Bouteille 75cl, merci à Pierre T.
Dorée sur un léger trouble, col blanc.
Arôme au nez fruité, pas mal de baies, fleuri, le tout est assez puissant et renforcé. Le côté funk est un peu caché par leffet des baies, on y retrouve un léger boisé.

Palais est puissant au niveau plaquebière avec le caractère de mûre pour leffet acidulé et un aspect épicé en bouche qui dure assez longtemps. Epicé reste fortement marquee par ces baies, le tout est finemetn terreux, râpeux virant sur les airelles à maquereau au niveau acidulé. Correcte mais sans vraiment comprendre langouement pour ce produit.

At akkurat. Years-long dream fullfilled here ! Pours clear blonde, small white head. Smell is very fruity, mild funk, some Wood. Taste is sour, very dry, extreme Cantillon funk as well as fruity wild yeasts , berries,together with their earthy Taste. Sourness, but in a balanced manner. Veru dry, but not astrigznt to a point it becomes negative. Wouldnt call it Balance, but i would call it a beer that looks upon the bounrizs of extreme tastes, without crossing them. Very very well done. Cantillon funk coöperaties extremely well with these fruits. One of the best Loons to date ! I agree with the previous rating - while blabaer is hyped up completely ( the pretties looking pour, but one of the least Loons ) this one is with all the good comments. I traveled to Sweden just to try this ( and some others ) and all I can say is im happy i did
@ Akkurat last summer. Quite sure this was the best lambic I ever had. This one is worth the hype, in contrast to the Blabaer
Was lucky enough to make it to Akkurat to try this. I had high expectations but was underwhelmed. For me it had too much going on and was poorly balanced.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2016 Bottle @ Akkurat 30/7-16. Shared with fillepolo. Fruity and bretty with a lot of horse blanket and barnyard, also acidic and woody. Body is medium, the finish is dry, tart and acidic with notes of grapefruit. Lovely!

Bottle @ akkurat Stockholm shared with Gaultier. Pours a golden colour beer with a small head. Fruity, bretty with a lot of cloudberries and a distinct taste of stable. A very well balanced beer that makes you want more and more with every sipp. Dry finish  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Bottle @ Akkurat - bottled in October 2015. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, berries and barnyard. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 250716

Bottle thanks to Polly. Pours a cloudy yellow gold with medium frothy white head leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is wood, citrus, funk, berry. Medium body, oak must, berry, stone fruit, funky, light tartness, really enjoyed this.

Pours clear peach with flat head. Aroma of cloudberries, grapes, apples, bretta, slightly funky. Taste is rich apple tart up front with a strong cloudberry finish. Light and crisp body with average carbonation.

Bottle @ Akkurat. Pours clear golden amber with a small head. Aroma is bretty dour fruity some cloudberry stable funky. Flavor is nicely sour fruity berry funky astringent wood. Great balance and very elegant.

Bottle at Akkurat, 2015 vintage. 
Aroma is very nice with a moderately strong berry aroma, though with and herbal, tannic note similar to berry leaves and skins. Light herbal note. Light oak notes. Berry is light enough to allow the base beer to show through. 
Pours a slightly hazy golden orange with a medium sized, white head that recdes steadily. Second pour had some berry sediment. 
Flavor has a medium to medium high berry note. A moderately strong tannic note from the berry skins and seeds with a bit of an herbal, berry leaf note. Medium light oak notes with some light hay and light bitterness. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. 
Overall, still not my favorite berry lambic as the tannins are a bit strong, but the berry notes are very unique. The lighter cloudberry character does a nice job of integrating with the base lambic.

Yellowish golden color with moderate head that dissipates pretty quickly. The nose is all cloudberries. The newer batches also have a bit of a plasticy thing going on, especially the 2013 vintage. Overall a very excellent beer.

Pours clear yellow with low white head 
Aromas of cracked garden branch, sour grapes, hints of baking soda, barnyard
Taste has acidic notes, funky, sour grapes, cloudberries, grassy, sour cherries, hints of baking soda
Pours hazy golden woth a thin line of white head. Aroma; Funk, lemon, hay, wood, cloudberry and some grapefruit. Flavour; Cloudberry, acid, funk, lemon, hay and wood. Bitter, sour and nice..
A: Light yellow with a nice one finger white head. N: Horse, hay, stable T: Cloudberry, green apples, horse, lemon O: Very fresh and very nice, more bitter than expected. Love it!

Bottle, Akkurat 20th anniversary batch, shared by James on 2/5/16.First off, a huge thanks to James for very graciously offering to share this with me with nothing in return expected and I will hopefully return the favor at some point.Thank god we had some cloudberry jam before trying this stuff. Not that the aroma wasnt amazing, but I was much more able to appreciate just how magnificent of a job they did in getting the pure, lovely cloudberry aroma and flavor in to the beer, after trying the jam. Nose is wow. Just wow. Jaw-dropping, awe-inspiring. However you want to phrase it. It was a long time before I even felt the need to take a sip of the stuff. Extremely difficult to describe cloudberrys aroma/flavor profile. Definitely some woodiness to it, as James suggested. Perhaps lightly cedary? Theres a dry apricot element and then a very wine-like character as well, almost riesling-like. Intense, hugely aromatic and unwavering, it captures the cloudberry perfectly in the nose and is decidedly much less funky than any other Cantillon Ive ever had. But thats fine, because this is one of the top 3 fruit aromas Ive ever smelled.In the flavor its quite wine-like, with the woodiness prominent, and the big juicy, fleshy, almost gooseberry-mixed-with-apricot-and-sugar character that I seem to associate with cloudberry. Tart, for sure, but less of the extreme funk that Cantillon is known for. Some, like GrumpyTroll, remark "Wheres the horseblanket?" and thats a fair critique. But I personally cant take fault with it when the fruit is captured so perfectly here. A truly incredible beer that very much met the years of hype and searching to try it. Hope to have it again some time soon at Akkurat!
UPDATED: FEB 18, 2016 Pours orange gold - nose and taste of strong cloudberry, old wood, funk and light horse blanket - med body. Bright cloudy berry.

Aroma of white wine, cloudberry jam, big funk, oak, light vanilla, caramel, lemon, grapefruit pith. Taste a bit more mellowed out, tart cloudberries with a lightly bitter oaky caramel, quite woody and citrusy, but still feels heavy. I think this one needs some age.

Köpt på Akkurat, Stockholm. Fantastisk på alla sätt, hade hjortronen tagit över än mer från Lambicen hade det blivit full pott. Det ska dock sägas att hjortronen tar stor och fräsch plats, världsklass!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 2015.
Simply the best lambic i have tried. The cloudberies is mindblowing in such fresh bottle. Wow. Better then blåbær. Amazingly balanced. Drank a.whole Bottle myself..

Initial sourness. Some mango in aroma with the oak and lemon peel the berries, cloudberry to be exact was well balanced not overpowering but evident. The base of lambic was fantastic. Tart and refreshing.

Bottle shared at the Moeder Lambic cellar tasting 2015. bottle provided by jean van roy himself. thanks so much! poured a slight hazy dark golden mixed with a orange shade colour with some white bubbles on top of the glass. the smell of cloudberries hits the nose. a real scandinavian fruit, wich gives the base lambic even a bit more of a sour taste. theres also some old hay, dusty cellar, sweet red cranberries, oak, and a lot of old wood funk. taste is [retty special with sweet sour cloudberries. even some exotic fruit. it is not as fruit forward as some of the other fruited lambics. but the cloudberries just gave the beer an unique expecrience of complext fruited layers. very bright and refreshing mouthfeel. im so happy i was able to try this unique cantillon!

Bottle shared at the Moeder Lambic cellar tasting 2015, donated from Jean van Roy, big thanks! Pours hazy orange with barely any head. Aroma of tart berries, cellar funk, cobwebs, light manure. Flavour is moderate sour. Medium bodied with very soft carbonation. Really lovely with a very interesting unusual fruit character.

[4/24/15] Bottle at Akkurat in Stockholm. 2013 magnum bottle. Rather clear golden. Lovely oaky funky aroma with lots of sweat, some cobwebs and fruitiness (some berries). Sour flavor, funky, lemony, oaky, with some sweat, some juicy fruitiness, and some stuff I cant put my finger on. Medium-bodied. Lovely complex stuff.

Magnum enjoyed @ Akkurat split 4 ways in Cantillon Gueuze Tumblers enjoyed @ Cellar temp.

A - 2 finger head. Faded quite fast. Looks a light orange gold in the glass. Looks like a standard lambic

S - mells like tangerine, grapefruit and apricot. Aroma is great but I can tell this will be quite the sour beer. 

T - The taste is really unique. Im not an expert in cloudberry so this is hard to rate. Lots of fruit, citrus and a bit of wine tannins. It does leave a lingering mouth puckering sour after a few sips. Some lemon pucker for sure. 

M - Not an explosive mouthfeel but also no where near flat. 

O - I expected a very sour beer but this is not really that sour. The fruit shines and excited me to go out and buy some Cloud-Berry Jam. A unique beer and Im so glad to try it.
Magnum shared with 50belair at Akkurat - pours golden yellow with orange hue. Tart, sour, earthy and lemon zest in the nose. Earthy, lemons, cloudberries in the taste. Solid!!!

Magnum enjoyed at Akkurat with Biggsbowler. Clear yellow pour with a white head. Kinda sour with floral and what I suppose is Cloudberrys on the nose. Sour with tasty but somewhat bitter berry highlights. So well balanced with mild funk and wet hay notes. A bit of grain in the back there. Fantastic mouthfeel and body. So stoked to have a chance to try this gem.

(750ml 2012 vintage bottle @ Akkurat, shared with friends) Pours a hazy pale gold with a small whitish head, no lace. Aroma of cloudberry, light blue cheese, touch of acetone, fresh smelling wood, surprisingly funky and kind of unique. On the palate, roundly acidic and wheaty with a vague berry note, brambles and herbs. The cloudberry comes back and bites on the dry, bitter finish with a bit of wheat and herbs. Medium bodied with little carb. Very nice!
A little different for a fruit lambic and it might get even better with age, but Im really glad I had the opportunity to try it.

Bottle (750 ml) @ Akkurat. Vintage 2012. Slightly hazy golden/orange with a small white head and little lacing. Aroma is quite fruity (this must be what cloudberries smell like) with a nice funky touch, oak and umami notes. Taste is also fruity with light funk, oak and umami notes. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Dry finish. Very good balance. Quite tasty too. Not the best fruit lambic from Cantillon (not even close to the FouFoune 2014 I had a few days ago), but still a very nice experience.

Bottle at Akkurat, with newfound friends via RateBeer. Pours a nice cloudy orange with a moderate white head. Aromas of citrus, peach, cloudberry, funk and a lovely farmhouse musky scent. Taste is citrus and cloudberry with some peach and musky, earthy almost umami notes as well. Mouthfeel is tart and dry with a nice tartness. Very very good!

Bottle at Akkurat, with friends. Light pale slightly hazy gold pour with disappearing white head. Aroma is fruity, really nice funky fruit, light leather notes, some oak. Taste is tart, fruity, almost jammy, nice fruity sweetness with mild acidity. Palate is light bodied, low carbonation. Nice stuff.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2015 8/15/2014: Bottle att akkurat with Taylor, Stefan and Kimberly. Pours clear orange with zero head. Aroma is un-ripened apricot,Mellon, phenolic plastic note that is a little offputting. Taste is sour mellon, sticky phenolic yeast note, oranges. This beer is too phenolic for me, perhaps it is still young and we should wait a number of years to judge it.

12/27/2015. Draft at Akkurats 20th anniversary party. This sample was way better than the young bottle. The beer has really cleaned up and is a fantastic and interesting fruited lambic. I think this will get better with time even though it is a fruited beer.

Flaska på Akkurat 2012 vintage lot 123. Gyllenfärgad/orange, lite skum, disig. Snätt syrlig doft av äppelcidervinäger, havtorn och hjortron. En snäll och inte särskilt oxiderad lambic med lätt bärig smak någonstans åt syrliga äpplen, gula bär. Jag tycker den växer medan man dricker och framstår mer komplex än vid första smakprovet. Sedan är man ju inte opåverkad av hypen heller. Svårt att betygsätta men riktigt riktigt gott.
Bottle. Golden pour with white head that disappeared, tart cloudberry and wild sour tones. Sour cloudberry, jam like, finishes tart but smooth. Not overally acidic on the finish.

2013 bottle @ Akkurat. First bottle was too phenolic, plastic and had traces of burnt rubber. Some months later and with more time to air and open up it has improved a lot. Tons of cloudberries and musty wood, not too sour but decent. Will most likely continue to develop in a good way.

Truly one of the most special fruited Cantillon Ive had the pleasure of tasting. Batch one 1999, bottle #265, 375ml, shared thanks to Bill at the Denver Ghost Tasting had a bracing acidity and sharp cloudberry-seed sourness to it, almost mealy in taste with a pulpy appearance. Age has definitely taken some of the fruitiness of the more recent fresh batch away, however its nice to see that the cloudberry is able to hold its own with some serious years on it. 
2012 vintage, Magnum, tasted at Akkurat 9/13, Extremely fresh and fruity, bursting with bright acidity and pulpy fruit consistency. Although I got a slight phenolic note, though that didnt detract much. Love that aroma of cloudberry compote and the resinous sediment left in the glass after taking the last sip. Opened a 750 ml later, a bit more honed in/composed, not as much phenol and hardly any indication of taint but still very young and green tasting. Will be interesting to see what age does to this batch.

Bottle @ Akkurat. 2012 vintage. Pours deep golden with a small fizzy goldenish offwhite head that quickly dissipates without leaving much trace on the glass. Smell is tiny sweet, fruity, funky and tiny phenolic with crackers, bursting cloudberries, hay, dry soil, lemon juice, yoghurt with cloudberry jam, leather, barnyard, apricots, cloudberry hard candy (if that even exists), German eiswein, yuzu, overripe grapes and very subtle hints of medicine and band aids. Taste is sour and fruity with crackers, cloudberries, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, unflavored yoghurt, hay, dry soil, barnyard, leather, ripe gooseberries, Riesling grapes, yuzu, unripe currants, horse blanket, orange zest, lemon zest and hints of pomegranate. Mouthfeel is soft, dry, tart, slightly mouth puckering and light to medium bodied. Finish is sour and fruity with crackers, cloudberries, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, yuzu, hay, dry soil, leather, barnyard, orange zest and lemon zest. Incredibly complex and increasingly tasty. First impression didnt blow me away but this is a beer to savor and analyze. Nose is slightly rough around the edges but the taste is a complete complex cloudberry orgasm. Im very happy to finally have done the pilgrimage to get myself some .rar cloudberry goodness.

17.04.2014, 0,75l bottle (2012 vintage) @ Akkurat Bar & Restaurant:
Nice fizzy shortlasting head, looks like lovely cloudberry juice. Aroma is very mild fruity, loaded with sour cloudberries, sorrel, hay, mild vinegar, seabuckthorn, grain, caramel, oak. Taste is mild acidic, sour cloudberries, sorrel, oak, grass, seabuckthorn, sour socks. Medium bitterness, dry acidic mouthfeel. OMG, what a lovely acidic fruitiness! Lovely!

Pour from a 2013 bottle at the West Lakeview Zwanze 2013 event. A bit of a plastic character behind the fruit. Similar to some strawberry sours. Otherwise fairly mild overall. Wish there was quite a bit more cloudberry and the base were more assertive.

Bottle @ Akkurat. I am sooo glad to finally taste this whale It pours hazy golden with a small white head 75cl bottle at Akkurat. Vintage ´13 2nd Batch fruity, acidic, some salty flavors, cloudberry, funk, lemon zest Awesome! loved it!

75cl, Vintage 2012, exclusive brew, with cloudberries, thx to Secret Santa!, complex sour fruit brew, sour/fruity and slightly floral/woody, balanced, hazy, nearly no head, very good brew, yet very expensive!

75cl bottle at Akkurat. 2013 Vintage. So glad I got to try my biggest want finally! It pours a clean light orange / apricot color with a small white head that dissipates quickly leaving some small white bubbles on the side of the glass. Aroma is what I can only describe as cloudberries. Intense notes of salt, plastic and berry jam. Funk and lemon zest. Taste is acidic but not overly so. Berry fruitiness and light sweetness upfront. Mild salty kick on the back of the sip. Some more strange cloudberry notes over some funk and lemon zest. Light on body with good carbonation. As someone has said, this is now very fruity and somehow lacking complexity vs other Cantillons. Its very unique but purely taste wise is not better then a kriek or framboise. Still thrilled for the opportunity.

2013 vintage at Akkurat. 

Pours slight hazy cider colored yellow with a finger of white head. 

Smell is funky, not that tart, good amount of berry in it.

Taste is crisp, very light acidity. Some bile in the middle, fruity and zesty. 

Lighter body.

I feel like this could develop more sourness over time and become much more complex, but it sort of tastes like a fancy Berliner right now. Something you could crush while mowing the lawn, not a whale. Still very good and glad I had the chance to try it.

Honored to try this .. . Pours a deep gold .. . Nice tartness, the fruit is well based .. . A rather easy drinker, i quite liked this! 

.. . . Not now boss its too early to discuss tardiness.
Rather complex, integrated, and nuanced, this lambic is not particularly sour. It is quite accessible but still very unique. Fruit is soft but not quite delicate.

750 ml bottle. Golden with tiny white head. Aroma sour and funky, sweet cloud berry notes and some jam, very pleasant. Taste is medium sour with very nice and clean cloud berry notes, almost a bit buttery. Grain and funk with a long fruity sour finish. Nice nice nice

Bottle shared by a generous friend. Golden hazy body, handsome white frost up top. No real head or lace to speak of. 

Aroma of grainy malt, melted plastic, phenolic band aids, yet still kinda nice. Lemony / grainy up front, tartness blends into the odd fruit character, hoppy at the end, finishes clean and dry. Low carb; just right. 

Interesting (and thrilled I got a ~4oz pour!), but I'd take most other Cantillons over this every time.

Batch 2 poured golden yellow with white fluffy head and nice lacing. The nose was stone fruit and citrus with a suttle musty wood character.
Flavor was musty oak, juicy apricot and tart berries. Champagne like mouthfeel with a complex finish
UPDATED: JUN 8, 2017 A lot of cloudberries, which I really like. Sourish aroma with some citrus notes. Similar nice flavour. Lovely beer!

Bottle. Slightly hazy golden with minimal white head. Lots of cloudberry in the aroma but also a bit of a plastic note. Medium sour, light body. Medium short finish. A good fun interesting sour but far from Cantillons best.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2014 Flaska. Stor hype. Härlig stämning! Väntar på fatet nu. 1,5h kvar.... Härlig funk och hjortron. Lite syntetiska inslag, lite som omogna hjortron kan ha. 

Fatet är helt underbart. Inget av det syntetiska, bara ren njutning 

Provsmak nu fyra månader senare och här har det verkligen hänt grejer. Mer kolsyra och skummar upp en liten krona. Tydliga hjortron både i doft och smak. De syntetiska dragen är i princip borta.  

--- 
Magnumflaska 140607. Delar på 10 pers efter bryggbesök på Carnegie. Inte hänt mycket sedan premiären. Lite mindre syntet och plåster. Men har tydligt åldrats långsammare än den senaste 75an för några månader sedan. Drag av hjortronsylt och hjortronkart. Fortfarande ung. Mår nog bra av ytterligare några år i källaren.

395SEK, 5% 750ml bottle at Akkurat on a Friday night when it was hopping!  2012 vintage Lot A123 Clear  light gold pour, slight haze of foam. Interesting aroma that I am finding tough to describe. It has a subtle fruitiness from the cloudberries with some Cantillon tartness. After warming up some oak started to come through as well. The taste is young, as Omhper noted it would benefit from some aging. It is sour, slightly lactic, causes some puckering but reveals the fruity cloudberry flavor in the lingering dry finish. Really cool stuff, once I have the Blaeber I will have hit the rare Cantillon trifecta!

2013 bottle. Golden colored body, decent size white head, spotty lacing. The nose is bright cloudberries, apricots, and lemons against a back drop of light oak and must. Flavor is similar with a nice juicy, fruity sweetness that pairs well with a lively acidity. Medium to light bodied, assertive carbonation, lingering finish. A real treat. I can see the oak and must developing further with time and adding further complexity.

Bottle at EBT2 2013. Shared with Mathieu87 and Joris. Thx Joris for sharing!
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, flat beer, little to no foam.
NOSE: very sweet, typical cantillon nose, didnt smell this before!
TASTE: very dry, dry out, though rather sweet, very sour, but amazing sweet finish! Never tasted cloudberries, but was amazing in this beer!

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2015 Wow. oak,oak and more oak aroma. Like sniffing fresh oak barrels smeared in with cloudberries. The whole bar smelled this one for sure. Taste: more oak with cloudberries, a little funk and sour. Finish of tart, cloudberries,some funk and some sour. When it warmed up: Less oak, a little more funkyness. Overall: the best lambic to date. That smell. Holy shit!

Bottle at Akkurat in stockholm. Chemical smell with burned plastic and aceton. Fruity taste with berries, dry and sour. The smell wasnt pleasant but I hope it will disappear over time. The taste was ok. Only poor beer Ive had from Cantillon

Bottle many thanks to one of the most perverse people I know. It pours hazy golden with a small white head. The nose is smooth, mellow tartness, cloudberry, juicy peach, apricot, faint floral and earth. The taste is smooth, tart berry, apricot, lemon, cloudberry, peach, zesty, mild acidity and mellow sweetness with a dry finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Smooth and pleasantly tart. Pretty tasty!

Ken is a legend. Hazy golden pour with heavily spotted lacing. Nose was crazy stuff. Very perfumey with heavy dried fruits and heavy herbal influence. Muddled lime, currants, apricot, tart, lychee. Taste is pleasant tartness, lemon cake, muddled lime, herbs, dried peach and apricot, light musky perfume. Light bitterness with a heavy sweet & juicy palate. Lengthy fruit driven finish. An unusual and very obscure beer to try

2 bottles poured at a small session event... Pours predominantly clear and transparent pale straw hue and topped with a minimal skimpy wispy white head... Aroma of odd spice and briney with a fair amount if sweet berry to pair alongside it. Salty and very unique but not saying its entirely welcoming... Flavors are smoother, sour but not hugely acidic with a slightly spicy floral note. Muted and earthy without an extreme bite. Lighter than medium bodied with a softer level of carbonation than expected. A little soft and unrefined. Young and obscure.

Bottle @ Bruces. Many thanks to a special friend for going above and beyond. The pours deep amber with a small head. The nose is earthy berry jam. Peaches, lychee, white grape. Smooth tartness. A touch of lemon wood. The taste is soft berry. Cranberry compote, tart lychee. Moderately fruity flavors. Ive never had cloudberries before, so I dont know how well the beer represents the flavors of the fruit. Dirty herb garden dirtiness. Wild bugginess. Light body, fine carbonation. Overall, quite nice. Enjoyable.

Bottle shared during opening night of Jacks Farewell Tour - big thanks to the Mad Man. Pours lightly hazy gold with a moderate, bubbly white head. Nose holds lots of sweaty fruits, apples, white grapes, berries. Light sweet flavor, funky sweat, some tangy berries, light biscuity cereal. Light bodied with fine carbonation. Moderate sourness to finish, light acidity, white grapes, more sweaty funk. Nice beer overall. Well balanced.
Bottle at Akkurat, Stockholm. Cloudberries, sourish aroma with some citrus notes. Similar nice flavour. Lovely beer I truly loved it!

24th May 2013Bottle at Akkurat. Hazy gold beer with a pink tint. Short lived white head. Palate is softish for a lambic. Semi dry and with a crispy trailing edge. Mild sourness, this is very approachable. Pleasant and interesting fruity tartness that is not quite like anything else and its not acid and thus is not too much. Finishes light and semi dry. Easy going and refreshing lambic.

(Bottle at Akkurat, Stockholm and draught at Oliver Twist, Stockholm, 18 May. 2012 vintage) Pale orange/golden colour with brief head. Slightly hazy on tap. Fruity, sourish nose with notes of citrus, grapefruit, cloudberries, green grapes, stable and northern Swedish mountain bogs. Fruity, tart taste with citrus, grapefruit, green grapes, cloudberries, hints of New Zealand hops, stable, barnyard, oak wood and a dry, tart finish. Medium body, dry. In my opinion it doesnt reach the heights of the first version, the berry character is a bit more subdued and understated. It will probably evolve with a couple of years in the cellar, so hopefully they will put a fair amount of bottles aside. Very tasty and refreshing beer. Very nice.

New batch bottle at Akkurat:

Full of fresh, sweet cloudberry flavour with a pleasant sourness to balance it all out. Slight phenolic character that didnt bother me at all or diminish the fruitiness of the beer either. Will be exiting to see how the beer evolves throughout the years.

Bottle at Akkurat 2012 vintage. Hazy orange with no head. Aroma: cloudberries, horse, a little bit of dung?, fruity, some funk, something strange in there that I cant put my finger on...Taste: balanced sourness with cloudberries, green apples, hay and classic some classic cantillon notes. For me the bottle felt a little bit young.
Also had on tap at Oliver Twist. The strange thing in the aroma was gone and the cloudberries were more prominent. All in all an awesome brew!
Bottle at Akkurat. Hazy amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma is sour berries, some tart, a general dry sourness to it. Flavour is sour, acidic, a bit of fruitiness. Finish is very sour.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2016 May 23, 2016. Bottle at Akkurat, 2015 vintage.  
Fruitier and smoother than last time.

May 18, 2013. Bottle at Akkurat, 2012 vintage.  Pours golden with a small white head. Aroma is cloudberries, oak, funky tart. Taste is medium sour and light sweet cloudberries. Medium body with the kind of sticky smoothness that is typical to cloudberry jam is present as well. 
8-4-8-5-16=41

Bottle at akkurat at release 
Phenolic character blended with cloudberries and some cantillon... I cant say if I like it or love it one of the coolest lambics Ive had due to the hype... But its not as good as 
Re rate when I had the keg. 4.6
Bottle when fresh 4.2

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2013 Bottle at Akkurat. Hazy light orange liquid with small white head. Aroma of lemons, apples, barnyard, sweet berries, wood, fruity funk and earth. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of cloudberries, barnyard and lemon. Medium bodied with low carbonation. Very nice, but not the best Cantillon Ive had. A bit phenolic (rubber) in the bottle, better from keg.

Bottle @ Akkurat, shared with Ludvig. Bottled 2012.

Awesome cloudberry flavours. However some strange band aid thing going on.

On tap @ Oliver Twist

Soo much better more berries no band aid.

This was an unlabeled bottle with a cork from 1999 into a Narke tulip given to a friend by a really good friend not in the USA.

A - Pours golden in color, fizzy white head, bubbles on top.

S - Super funky tart nose, light fruit, some booze for only 5%. The fruits are sweet but Im not exactly sure I can pick out cloudberries. Musk, hay, and light acidity.

T - Super sour, tart, light booze burn on the finish, lightly oxidized, light fruit aspect....not sure if its cloudberries or not, but some fruit is there. For only 5%, Im surprised how much alcohol there is on the way down. The finish is very tart, light fruit.

M - Light body, light carbonation, dry finish.

O - Sour...very sour. Not as much finesse as I thought there would be with this Lambic. I think the fruit has been overtaken by the tart funky notes, but still, theres some complexity. I am grateful to have tried this beer, and I know Ill never have it again. Thanks to my friend for making this happen because of some genuine beer karma....much deserved.

Wow, never thought I would have an opportunity to try this beer. This is without a doubt the pinnacle of my beer drinking career. I will try to do the beer justice with this review. The beer pours a hazy tangerine color with a small white head. Great carbonation still after so long. Ive never smelled or tasted a cloudberry, so these next two categories will be hard to judge. The nose is incredibly musty with some pretty prominent urine notes, I dont know why, but its incredibly appealing to me. Soleil is crazy sour, probably the most sour Cantillon Ive ever had. Typical Cantillon funk and lemon rind. Light mouthfeel, gentle carbonation, good acidity, and a moderate finish. Fantastic beer and such a treat to enjoy, I would probably still rate Loerik above this, but that takes nothing away from this. An incredible experience that Ill never forget. Thanks guys!

About as rare as it gets tick... Doesn't hold up as well as some other older cantillons, ie gooseberry and red currant... A bit oxidized, very sour but with a bit of alcohol and vinegar, touch of tart fruit, rind... Good not great but a very grateful 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle no.50, courtesy of and shared with Per, ENORMOUS THANKS! Hazy, almost misty amber body, small white head that went away fast. Full cloudberry blast in the nose mixing with some Cantillon funk. Very nice. Probably the most clearly pronounced fruitiness that Ive tried in a Cantillon so far, strong hjorton definitely. The acidity isnt excessive. Oh fuck yeah. Special stuff.

Murky orange-brown. The cloudberries are still very present after all these years and have aquired a very "ripe" and exclusive flavour. There is a light funkiness and stableness, a little tart. It is extremely dry in the end, with a very cheekdrying effect. It manages to be incredibly complex and very simple at the same time, a feature which few beers reach. A great beer, its sad that it will probably never be made again.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2011 Tried it a second time, and it is totally spectacular.
Probarbly the best in the world.

Cantillon Soleil de Minuit (årg. 1999).
Vilken fantastisk doft den hade. Fina aromer och en smak som trots sina 10 år fortfarande är mycket bärig. Ölen var ganska syrlig och hade en eftersmak som måste vara något av det bästa jag har känt någon gång. Det var lite vemodigt att tömma de absolut allra sista dropparna.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2010 Soleil de Minuit is a simple lambic, really --

There are the cloudberries, slightly sweet, somewhat tart, but still fresh after eleven years in the bottle. Then comes the lambic, easily recognizable as Cantillon - ripe socks, yellow woodsorrel, and antique armoires. The whole thing goes down with a champagne consistency.

-- and since this was available only in magnums, that came in handy!
user_location: The Court of the Crimson King, California, USA

text:
Bottle shared with Hirigalzkar, Gyllenbock and other Stockholm beer blog celebrities.

Great brew with taste, aroma and mouthfeel of cloudberries. Sweet and fresh despite the age.

75 cl bottle at Akkurat in July 2010. (vintage 1999)

In my youth I spent a lot of time in Lapland. Grandmas cloudberry jam was fantastic, cloudberries are the gold of Lapland. 

Cantillon Soleil de Minuit was without doubt one of the best beers I have ever tasted, truly an amazing experience. Wonderful aroma and taste of cloudberries, It was difficult to understand that the beer could still taste so much cloudberry.

Very sour despite its age, long aftertaste. It was propably the last bottle ever sold at Akkurat. Wow!

Bottle @ Akkurat. Pours orange, no head. Im impressed with the fruitiness in the aroma, as I would have expected the agening to have taken some edge off it. Enormous sweet cloudberry aroma! Some sour blackcurrant seeds are there in the background. Taste is very sour, but also very fruity. A small bitterness in the end. Not the most complex fruit lambic, but very, very fruity and the sweetness balances the usual sourness in a perfect way. I just love cloudberries!

1.5L bottle, shared at Akkurat on Sept 25 09  with my cousin, ggaughan. 1999 Vintage. The bottle arrived covered in dust, with a very small label on the neck. 
Pours straw to golden color, with a slight  haze. The off-white head begins  one-finger thick, and gradually fades to a thin ring that persists to the last sip. The tart berry aroma is fairly intense and can be picked up from a few feet away. Tart berries take the forefront, and are nicely complimented by lemon, wheat, earth and a firm lactic backbone. The flavor was moderately tart and fairly acidic, with the cloudberries integrating quite nicely with the gueuze.  Lemon, brett, and earthy character compliment the tartness and add depth. The berry character clings to the soft palate for a lengthy finish, and seem to become more pronounced as they linger. This was a great experience, and one of the biggest highlights of my beer travels.

I have been waiting to try this beer for so long and was dissapointed to find they did not have 75cl bottles of this at Akkurat when I visited in August 2008. On a return trip in September 2009 my cousin krkearney and I split a 1.5 litre magnum of it ourselves! Vintage 1999. The beer poured a slight hazy golden color with a 1/2 inch head. Bottle appeared flat as there was no pop when the cork was removed but there was definite life left in the bottle. The nose had a very unique and interesting berry character. A bit tart as well. The taste had a strong tart and acidic character. Lovely berry notes, a bit of wood and pepper in the background. The cloudberries are very present in this beer and make for a fantasticly unique beer.

Bottle 75cl. [ Vintage 1999 ].Unclear medium yellow orange color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, fully lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy barnyard, gastric acid, wet yeast, cloudberry. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet, heavy acidic and bitter, vinegar, and heavy sour with a long duration, dry and very sour finish. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft - flat. [250908]

(Bottle 75 cl) Hazy amber golden with an off-white head. Very unusual aroma from the cloudberries. Medium body, strange dusty touch and again these very unusual berry accents before a massive acidity in the finish. 061008
Hazy amber with tiny off white head. Sour aroma with berries, grapefruit and accidig notes. Sor flavour with barnyard, accidig and sour berries. Ends sour. Lovely!

Bottle at Akkurat. Clear amber - white head. Cloudberries (multebær), light sweetness, light disolved white sugar, light dusty, "amber", nice round mouthfeeling with medium dry/acid finish. OK - It is supposed to have been better !!!

Akkurat bottle A man tries not to be influenced by those things, but the staff needing half an hour to fetch the beer you were looking forward to, the INAO Cantillon glass it comes into, th classy basket that is used for service, the unlabeled bottle, the still noisy pop upon opening... they make a lasting impression and sets the mood for what one may call a beer experience. Following, the opaque golden to pale orange pour wears a lasting, finely laced 1cm cover despite its 8 years. Fantastic fresh nose then keeps you on your cloud.Delicate and refined hay flavor (a trait that this particular rater particularly adores), complemented by various fruits, the usual lactic qualities, yogurt-like and a very frank, by Cantillons standards, citrus attack, lemony and orangey all at once. The barnyard soft farminess that forms the landscape is not without a certain crispness despite a minimal corkiness that hints at cellar conditions. Very smooth champaign like carbonation, comfortable... Well, this one meet the equilibrium between dryness, tartness, freshness.. between lactic and citric acidity. All the while, generous grapeyness borders cranberries. Lots of words, but its not the most complex beer, it remains focused and on elegance at that. Vinous. An utmost classic, classy and seemingly untouched by the years. A favorite from Cantillon I would say. Im anxious to try Pers cloudberry jelly now:)

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden/roange color with a small thin white head. Tart fruity cloudberry aroma, with some barnyard hints. Sweet malty tart fruity flavor with some weak hints of cloudberry. Tart fruity finish with some bitterness in the aftertaste.

Bottle: Pub Vildanden, Lund. 

Ive been looking forward to this one for a while. Comes in a beautifully wrapped 375ml Champagne bottle. Not much pop in the cork was a small worry, but  the beer poured a slightly hazed apricot colour and a small white head rose, and stayed around for only a short while. 
 
Aroma is simply amazing, incomparable to anything Ive smelt before, sure... it has some of the Cantillon house notes that show in all their beers, but the sheer intensity and complexity of fresh cloudberry combined with bretty notes separates it. You could smell it from at least a meter away. Up close, I noted some composting lemons, vanilla, oak, as well as a slightly more intense brett character than most Cantillons Ive tried before. Words do not really describe the depth and complexity the aroma has, all I can do is say wow and give it a 10. The first sip carries a sharp acidity, but rounds out into a smooth fruity tang, the cloudberry is far more subdued than in the aroma and almost tastes more like very ripe apricot. Other flavours are of oak, carsick, vanilla, lime and white grapes. A small step down from the aroma, but to be honest it was always going to struggle to live up to that. Finish is acidic, sharp, dry but fruity. A classic beer I will never forget.

37,5 cl bottle at Akkurat, Stockholm. Bottled in 1999. I do not think I have ever seen such a beautiful beer with its pinkish orange colour, cloudy, and with that irresistable eggwhite head that stays till the very end. Immensely complex aroma; cheese is very prominent, farmyard aromas puts the sharp acidity somewhat in the background. Flavours are more fruity with the lemony lambik characterin the lead, though cheese is always there. The mellow character of the cloudberries are only very faint, but what can you expect from a 7 year old bottle of fruit lambik? Still quite lively and definitely dry to the bone. It is a beer that makes you see the midnight sun even on a winter night in Stockholm.

375ml bottle at the <a
href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Place/sweden/s target=blank>Akkurat in Stockholm, Sweden.  Vintage 1999.  Golden orange in colour, dissipating white head, no lacing.  The cloudberries in the aroma are spectacular and they provide the sweetness, sour and tart, some wood, light orange zest, acidic.  Easy one of the best aromas I have come across.  I didnt think that it could get any better then the aroma until I tasted it.  Wow.  The cloudberry sweetness balanced with the usual Cantillon funk make this one fun lambic.  Apples, cheese, must, acidic.  Lightly sour mouthfeel, medium body, medium/high carbonation.  Finishes sweeter then most Cantillon lambic, it seems to last forever.  Astonishing is the only word I can think of.

Bottle at Akkurat, 2006. I think the vintage was 99. Beautiful orange, cloudberry colour. Sparkling. The nose is full of lambic sourness and cloudberries. So is the taste. Dry and sour, surprised at how well the cloudberries go with the lambic, as if they were made for each other. The combination really makes sense. Seems Ill have to get a hold of some other Cantillon brews in the future.
UPDATED: JUN 9, 2006 Bottle at Vildanden Lund. Mmm... cloudberrys. A fantastic and really interesting lambic from Cantillon, thanks Akkurat!

Bottle.
Hazy golden coloured with a small but lasting off white head.
Aroma of horse blanket and wood with light acidic notes.
Flavour of horse blanket, wood, berries and cloudberries with light acidic notes.
Not as acidic as most other lambics from Cantillon.

Beautiful dark golden, little unclear body with a small beautiful white head that lasts; Super, super deep exceptionally complex, very intense nose. Very interesting balance between sweet and sour. The Hjotron stands out exceptionally clear, with some sweetness (I only know the smell of Hjotron from Hjotron jam, though), behind it there are lots of grapefruit, wood, vanilla etc. IT IS JUST FANTASTIC!; The body is very, very sour and dry and fits the nose perfectly; It moved into a just as sour and dry finish, again with lots of Hjotron in extreme lengths. Very, very well balanced beer, even when this sour and this dry. AMAZING!!!

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2007 First ratingBottle at Akkurat in Stockholm, Sweden. November 2005. Brewed for Akkurat by Cantillon, flavored by cloudberries. Put on bottle in 1999, matured well since.Very nice smooth scent and flavor, well balanced but still sour. Part from the price I wouldnt mind having a few more ot these.9/4/9/4/18=4.4Second rating(Bottle at Pub Vildanden, Lund)Shady copper color, white head. Sweet mixed with sour scent, some cloudberry as well. Sour cloudberry fruity sweet taste, also citrus. Cloudberry aftertaste. Spritzy mouthfeel, low bitterness.9/3/9/3/17=4.1Average rating: 9/4/9/3/18=4.3

Bottled. Hazy orange colour, mediumsized white creamy head. Sour berries in aroma (you cant really tell which), along with typical cantillonish dry sourness. Pleasant lambic, which has been stored for a while. Only thing that sucks is that it completely lacks cloudberries in flavour and aroma...

Bottled 37,5cl
Hazy orange, creamy white head. Typical Cantillon nose: sour, fruity. Earthy, sour, fruity, dryness cuts cloudberry flavors. Balanced, sour Cantillon. Ageing has cut the corners. Great.

([email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */) Opaque orange color with no head. Dry, fruity cloudberry aroma. Very authentic cloudberry flavor with some rough bitterness in the finish (because of the cloudberry seeds, maybe). Dry, sourish, contrapting palate with a nice, mouthdrying finish. Nice, enjoyable and dry, as can be expected from Cantillon...

Pours a cloudy golden, with a frothy white head. Aroma  is intense of fresh cloudberries, and cantillon funkyness. Taste is tart, with the usual Cantillon barnyard/brett parts, a rather sweet cloudberry part, and som sourness.

I love this. Hazy deep orange coloured. Probably the best aroma ever in a beer. It is really hard to remove your nose from the glass. Huge aroma of fresh cloudberries. Even though the beer is now seven years old the aroma has not changed much becoming less fruity as in most fruit lambics. Very acidic and complex flavour with lots of citrus and cloudberries present.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2013 75 cl bottle at Akkurat, Stockholm. Somewhat hazy pale golden beer with a small white head. Sourish fruity aroma, rubber, leather, cloudberries, citrus, grapefruit, floral notes, earthy, red berries, funky, tart, some mango. Sour fruity flavor, cloudberries, hay, grapefruit, citrus, earthy, tart, sourish, leather, grapes, unripe pears, red berries, funky, woody notes, yeasty, acidic, some horse blanket. Sour finish with cloudberries, citrus, grapefruit and earthy notes. Great lambic.

Bottled, at Essen Kerstbierfestival 2004 courtesy of a fellow babbler. Slightly hazy amber, low white head and gentle condition. Intense sweet fruity citric lambic funkiness in the nose, there is a slight dryness initialy in the mouth but then the fruity berries mix with the tart acidic lambic notes to create an intensity of flavours that seem to enhance each other. Long, long dry farmyard notes and gentle tart fruitiness. The cloudberry seems to be the perfect fruit to balance the tart austerity of Cantillon Lambic. Deserves a wider audience.

Pours hazy orange golden with a fine off-white head. Extreme aroma. Sour and salty with strong notes of wild fermentation and a funny tone of anchovy. Acidic tart flavor with citrus and again anchovy tones. Salty and dry specially in the finish. Sour as hell though the sourness dies quite fast. Complex and interesting and very refreshing!

Bottled. 
Amber, slight hazy. Big aroma from ripe/old cheese and cloudberry. Milky acidic mouthfeel, a little citric and a hint of boiled eggs. Very special.

Bottled: Orange colour. Unclear. White thin head. Is very fruitdense in the aroma. Must be the cloudberry. Has a subtle sourness in the background. The flavour is bloody fantastic. The fruitsweetness and the sourness is perfectly mingled in this one. Could go on and drink this forever. Is light acidic and cleansing in the end. I had both the ordinary and the special Soleil. My rating on 4,6 is a avg. of the 2. 4,5 for the ordinary and 4,7 for the special.

Lactic fruity nose, apparently cloudberries, which are reminiscent of currant. Cloudy medium amber with white lacing head. Medium body with light-medium carbonation. Huge lactic fruity berry start, giving way to a saliva inducing tannic bitterness. Great taste, with light bitter chlky fiih and after. Very good stuff

I love Cantillon beers and think that JP Van Roy should be considered a God to serious beer lovers.  I have sampled most of the Cantillon beers and thought that without visiting Sweden I'd never get the chance to sample this beer - until a friend brought me a bottle back!  It was opened with reverence and very high expectations.  The colour and aroma were pure Cantillon, hazy gold with lemon, very acidic and woody.  The taste, however, didn't live up to my expectations.  I've never tasted a cloudberry by itself, so I assume they are very sour and acidic?  The Cantillon lambic is drowned out by a rush of tongue rasping acidity and sourness, yes even too much for me!  Bone dry in body with some hints of other flavours such as pineapple, or maybe rhubarb.  I have to be honest and say that I didn't really take to this beer, maybe the fruits and Lambic didn't match with my palate or something.  I don't know, but I was left feeling disappointed.  (sampled in bottle from Stockholm beerfest)

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2004 [The special version - the first bottles made] A hazy orange beer with a fine white head. The aroma is lovelywith strong notes of cloudberries as well as acid and grapefruit. The flavor is lovely too with the sourness drawing the mouthwater - it is quite lactic with lots of cloudberry notes. [The ordinary] Afar this beer has a strong aroma of cloudberries - but sticking your nose in the glass turns the aroma sour, with sweet and sharp notes - like a lambic. The color is a hazy orange and it has a good but collapsing head. The flavor is sharp, sour, and sweet - just like a wild-fermented beer should be. The cloudberries makes up a great background for the above mentioned flavors. A very special beer - but not as good as I had hoped. [8/3/7/3/16]

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2007 #250(sampled at Akkurat, Stockholm, Sweden) Hazy dark golden/orange with a small thick white head. Very intense sweet aroma of cloudberries. Very sour and salty flavour with a tart flavour of cloudberries. Very sour finish. Unique.

Pale orange, hazy colour. Medium head. Big cloudberry aroma. Sweet clouberry- flavour followed by acidic lambic-flavour. I dont think they mix very well or is it just that I never liked cloudberries very much. Yeah, thats probably it.

Heavenly golden rays shine through the soft white clouds, I am entranced. . . A sweet smelling breeze comes to my nose and just as I inhale turns sour, stony and leathery.  In my trance I am fed small orbs I have never seen before, their flavour is a mouthwatering, tart funkiness. . . I reach out for more. . . this time there is an initial rush of sweetness only to be followed by more mouth-puckering tartness. . .  Oakes, thanks for setting the stage for this wonderful dream . . .

Bottle #52 of 1000, 1999, sampled 7/2003brewed with cloudberries - blond-orange colour, nice creamy head, very deep fruity aroma (orange, blackberry), deeply complex (vinegar, farm and haye), strong and beautiful acidity, fresh, long dry orange and vinegar finish - I'm totally confused by this fantastic experience; this is a beer to respect - Thanks to Per for this one !

Bottle #52, year 1999I'm completely lost! Difficult to evaluate this one… orange color, hazy; very strong nose, acid, fruity; in the beginning nearly smells, then I get used to it, appreciating more and more the fruits. Orange character in the final. Very strange.

Typicaly peppery sour cantillon house aroma, with the addition of an indescribable (for me) fruity essence.  Flavor is sour with the earthy remnants of a fruit flavor.  Complex and very interesting.  I need to track down some cloudberry jam, so I can begin to get my head around this beer.  A beer I'd always wanted to taste, and I assumed I'd never get the chance with out actually going to Stockholm.  Thanks for the treat!

This is a wonderful lambic - with a wispy, clean fruit aroma and a really sour initial flavor(cloudberries?), Soleil de Minuit finishes quite differently from where it begins - it leaves one with a certain sweetness.  Complex and lovely.
Cloudy lambic . White head.   Sour as is should be cherry and young gooseberry tartness. I caused havoc on my sensitive palate ... I am serious...

Summer Gathering 2003: Fascinating, very different stuff. Sweet nose, hints of currants or blueberries. A certain funkiness--olives or pimientos going on in there. Cloudy yellow. Intensely sour, salty, funky, touch of olives, blueberries, and gin. Very dry and lip-smackingly tart.

Cloudy yellow/gold w/ little head. Musty, tart but sweet brine aroma w/ some horse blanket & leather notes. I assume the fruitiness is Cloudberry, but I've never had cloudberries. Light, dry, acidic feel. Very sour, salty, briny flavour combines with an almost lemony fruitiness.

Thanks to Oakes for this pleasure.  Very odd, but intriguing nose. Sort of like a pimento olive in a very dry martini.  Sweet and sour tasting, often dry and elusive.  We all spent a lot of time with this sample and I, for one, am going on a cloudberry search at Ikea very soon.  Refreshing and slightly complex, excellent fruit flavor for a fruit I have yet to try on it's own.

RBSG2003. The single most sweet and tart simultaneity I have ever experience, bar none. Delicious. Salt and leather are there among the cloudberry (?) sweetness (I have to get me some of those!). Thanks Josh!
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Hazy apricot orange with a nice, but not outrageous, head.  The aroma was one of the most unique experiences of my life, likely due to the cloudberry, with which I have no experience before this.  Both tart and sweet at the same time.  A nice tart fruitiness is present, not unlike, but better than, the FouFoune.  Acidic and tart throughout.  The fruit usually helps cut the bite, but I think it may have only enhanced it here.  This was a very lucky opportunity for me, and I owe many thanks to Oakes for allowing me to sample this.  A tremendous offering from Cantillon.

Colour: hazy orange; thick wild head, nearly immediately gone. Nose consists of a lesser fruitexplosion. I suppose it are cloudberries, but it makes me think of pineapple, or very sweet rosy grapefruit. Horseblanket is there as well, as well as something like VERY fresh, living seafood.
Taste comes with the Cantillon acid-bite, surrounding an astounding fruity taste. Rosy grapefruit comes to mind again. The fruityness definitely mellows the acidity. My wife, however speaks about decaying and oxydizing vegetable matter...
There is some throat-burn, so quite some acids. Refreshing, too. No new aftertaste, just the aromas of the fruit, esters and fruitacids lingering on. A rare one, this, to be consumed with moderation and reverence.

Sampled bottle (no.373) was stored for two years. It´s golden and cloudy with huge aroma of cloudberries with a sourish tone and a hint of mineur. The flavor is sourish with a cloudberry tone and lots of cloudberries in the finish. A beer that´s just keeps getting better and better. When it first arrived in june 2000 I thought it was a bit too tart but it has developed extremely well.
Pale yellow. Somewhat hazy. Sweet cloudbery smell. Big cloudberry aroma, tart finish. Obvious cask character.

This is a breakthrough in brewery (almost..). Combining swedish cloudberries with Belgian beerbrewing is genious! This lambic was produced by the swedish pub Akkurat (norwegian for correct), Jamtlands Brewery in Sweden (correct me if Im wrong) and Brasserie Cantillon in Belgium. What Ive heard (Im a regular at Akkurat in Stockholm) is that some swedish guys sent 300 kilos of cloudberries down to Cantillon and got back around 3000 bottles. They sell this rare lambic at Akkurat for 105 SEK (around $10 USD) and its damn worth the money! I have had atleast 10 bottles of this sour, yellowish lambic the last 3-4 months and this is one of the reasons I go to Stockholm regularly (I work now in Oslo, Norway).

Cloudberry lambic made for Akkurat pub in Stockholm.  Yes, it is very sour, but unlike certain other Cantillon fruit beers, this one you can actually taste the fruit, as the cloudberry flavour bursts out.  Very juicy and refreshing. Earthy notes.  A side note - if you thought Cantillon was expensive in the USA, you should see how much it costs in Sweden!
